Engineering Analysis Required For:

Determining actual percentage of buildable area
Identifying optimal development locations within parcels
Confirming no-rise certification feasibility
Establishing precise elevation requirements
Validating construction methodology

8 Diplomatic Municipal Engagement Strategy
Cooperative Approach:

Acknowledge city staff expertise and preliminary assessments
Express willingness to work within municipal guidelines
Frame engineering analysis as verification rather than challenge to city estimates
Position detailed surveys as standard due diligence for responsible development
Key Messaging:

"We appreciate the city's preliminary guidance on buildable areas"
"Our engineering analysis will verify and refine these estimates"
"We're committed to compliant development that meets all regulatory requirements"
"Professional surveying will help us optimize design within actual site constraints"
Political Positioning:

Avoid adversarial stance on buildability estimates
Make engineering verification seem routine and cooperative
Allow city staff to save face if engineering reveals different buildable areas
Present surveys as partnership to achieve mutual compliance goals
8.4 Timeline and Cost Considerations
Key Principle: Treat all buildability estimates as preliminary until confirmed by professional engineering analysis. The regulatory framework permits development, but the extent and configuration must be determined through site-specific engineering.

Technical Methodology: Python/GIS analysis of MARIS DFIRM data
Regulatory Research: Federal CFR, Mississippi Administrative Code, Municipal Ordinances
